item.title: Wet and dry cat food outside front door, 1st November
item.description:
We have new neighbours move (No12) who own cats. They keep their cats outside, so also keep the wet & dry food outside too. However, there are a lot of rats near our estates. We see rats on our first floor quite a lot recently. This is attracting rats.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Median Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Road markings on roundabout are difficult to see., 1st November
item.description:
I would like to report a road safety concern at the roundabout on North Cray Road (A223), Bexley. The give-way road markings on the approach are fading and are no longer clearly visible. In addition, the GIVE WAY sign on the right-hand side is partially hidden by overgrown vegetation, making it difficult for drivers to see. Due to these visibility issues, I recently had a near-collision because it was not clear that I needed to give way to traffic already on the roundabout. This presents a serious hazard, particularly for drivers who are unfamiliar with the area. Please could this location be inspected and the following actions taken: • Repaint / restore the give-way road markings • Cut back vegetation to make the GIVE WAY sign clearly visible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A223, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement and potholes, 1st November
item.description:
Hello all In addition to the leaves and trash which have not been collected for two weeks, the pavements and the following streets (Lowman Road, Dunford Road and Jackson Road) have not been maintained for a long time and it is becoming very dangerous for bikes given potholes and difficult to navigate with a wheelchair given the uneven pavements. Please could somebody look into this. Thanks Best
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-25, Lowman Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet
